articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkey said on Monday its air force "neutralised" 26 Kurdish militants in strikes in Syria and northern Iraq in response to the killing of soldiers at the weekend, while authorities also detained dozens of pro-Kurdish opposition activists.
articles.title: Turkey retaliates at home, abroad after troops killed in Iraq

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran denied on Monday a U.S. claim that a drone launched from Iran had struck a chemical tanker in the Indian ocean.
articles.title: Iran denies US claim it targeted tanker near India

articles.author: Fayaz Bukhari
articles.description: The Indian army has launched an investigation into the deaths of three civilians allegedly in military custody in Indian Kashmir, and moved senior officers from the disputed area, a military official said on Monday.
articles.title: Indian army orders inquiry into alleged civilian deaths in custody

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A fire that broke out on Russia's only nuclear-powered icebreaker and cargo ship was promptly extinguished, the Murmansk branch of the emergency ministry said late on Sunday.
articles.title: Fire briefly breaks out on Russian nuclear-powered icebreaker

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Niger has suspended all cooperation with the international organisation of Francophone nations (OIF), its military leaders said, as it progressively severs ties with former colonial ruler France.
articles.title: Niger suspends cooperation with international Francophone body

articles.author: Alexander Tanas
articles.description: The head of Moldova's largest Orthodox Church, subordinated to its Russian parent church, has complained that his ranks were coming under attack in the run-up to Christmas -- marked on two separate days by rival churches in the former Soviet state.
articles.title: In Moldova, the Christmas spirit is conflict and rivalry for parishioners

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Bassam Masoud, Dan Williams
articles.description: Pope Francis lamented the war in the Holy Land where Palestinian health officials said airstrikes killed at least 78 people on Christmas Eve in one of the Gaza Strip's deadliest nights in Israel's 11-week-old battle with Hamas.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes kill dozens, Gaza officials say, in Christmas bloodshed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched 31 drones and 2 missiles at Ukraine overnight, mostly targeting the south of the country, with air defences destroying 28 drones and both missiles, the Ukrainian military said on Monday.
articles.title: Ukraine's air defence destroys 28 out of 31 Russia-launched drones, Kyiv says

articles.author: Jose Torres
articles.description: Thousands of migrants arrived on Sunday in the southern Mexican town Alvaro Obregon to spend the Christmas Eve in a public square without shelter before making their way north to cross the country and reach the border with the United States.
articles.title: Migrant caravan spends Christmas on the road before heading to U.S. border

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thousands gathered in the centre of Belgrade in an anti-government protest on Sunday to demand the annulment of parliamentary and local elections a week ago that international observers said were unfair.
articles.title: Thousands protest in Belgrade to demand annulment of elections
